intro: Daviesia costata, commonly known as the mountain daisybush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces showy, fluffy white or pale pink inflorescences that are highly attractive to pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive serrated edge. Daviesia costata typically grows in well-drained soils in open habitats such as heathlands and forests.
